verses.text: To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, A Psalm orSong of Asaph. To thee, O God, do we give thanks, to theedo we give thanks: for thatthy name is near, thy wondrous works declare.
When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.
The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.
I said to the fools, Deal not foolishly; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
Lift not up your horn on high: speak not witha stiff neck.
For promotion comethneither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.
But God isthe judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

For in the hand of the LORD there isa cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture, and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs of it all the wicked of the earth shall wring themout, anddrink them.
But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; butthe horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
